subject: Re: [junit] Remote pairing
msgSnippet: Hi all, do you know: - Google Summer of Code 2006: RT Shared Editor http://code.google.com/soc/eclipse/appinfo.html?csaid=DF1E75342ABC7051 - details available
messageBody:
Hi all,

do you know:
- Google Summer of Code 2006: RT Shared Editor
http://code.google.com/soc/eclipse/appinfo.html?csaid=DF1E75342ABC7051
- details available at: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/RT_Shared_Editing

The author explicitely refers to XP paradigm and pair programming.

It is based on Eclipse Communication Framework (ECF) for collaboration
infrastructure.

Bye, Jochen


On 2/27/07, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
>
> Yes, that's the one! Last time I looked, the website was totally empty,
> though.
>
> Would be interesting to see whether it works with a current version of
> Eclipse (although I doubt it...).
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>
> Mark Levison schrieb:
> > A few minutes digging found that the plugin is called Sangam.
> Sourceforge:
> > http://sangam.sourceforge.net/ and
> > http://www.industriallogic.com/software/sangam.html. It appears to have
> been
> > a collaboration of Industrial Logic and NC State university. A quick
> glance
> > suggests the code was last edited in 2004. Still if it works who cares.
> >
> > Any one care to take a try?
> >
> > Cheers
> > Mark
